definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format

sentences.english: It is the one day in the year when most of us grow big of heart and broad of mind.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节是一年中大多数人心胸开阔，气度非凡的一天。

sentences.english: Like I said, he's really big at heart.
sentences.chinese: 正像我说的，他确实心胸开阔。

sentences.english: The ocean will make your open-minded, the Lao mountain then lets you realize pure falsely with secluded .
sentences.chinese: 大海会使你的心胸开阔，崂山则让你体会清虚与幽静。

sentences.english: Fourth, Gray wolf have big-hearted sunshine psychology.
sentences.chinese: 第四，灰太狼有心胸开阔的阳光心态。

sentences.english: Leaders should be broad-minded enough to tolerate different opinions.
sentences.chinese: 领导者应该心胸开阔，始能容忍不同的主张。

sentences.english: Open-minded, very easy to get along with others at the same time, hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 心胸开阔，很容易与人相处，同时，爱好广泛。

sentences.english: Encourage openness to yourself and to novelty.
sentences.chinese: 鼓励自己心胸开阔，接受新奇事物。

sentences.english: At this moment the sea very broad, open-minded guests, unlimited horizons.
sentences.chinese: 此刻大海无比壮阔，观者心胸开阔，视野无限。

sentences.english: Most people confuse open-mindedness for tolerance towards the things that they don’t normally associate with or practice.
sentences.chinese: 许多人都会把心胸开阔和宽容一切混淆起来。
心胸开阔，易于沟通，有团队合作精神。

sentences.english: Only the broad-minded, delicate features, can make more friends.
sentences.chinese: 只有心胸开阔，气度恢宏的人，才能多交朋友。

sentences.english: She was truthful, open-hearted and cheerful.
sentences.chinese: 她实事求是，心胸开阔，快活。

sentences.english: At this time, my mind is open and I am my sincere self.
sentences.chinese: 此时我的心胸开阔，是一个真正的我。

sentences.english: I always believe in being broad-minded.
sentences.chinese: 我始终坚信，心胸开阔，大有好处。

sentences.english: Extrovert, out going nature and broad mindedness are some of the Leo sign characteristics.
sentences.chinese: 开朗外向和心胸开阔的个性是狮子座的主要特性。

definition: one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
to be of service to others/to help others/benevolent
lit. can pick it up or put it down (idiom)/fig. to take what comes/to meet gains or losses with equanimity
pinyin: na2 de5 qi3 fang4 de5 xia4

definition: not caring about fame and fortune (idiom)/indifferent to worldly rewards
spacious and well-lit/open and clear/(of character) optimistic/cheerful/carefree
